knowledgeBase.response: To improve your network speed: 1) Restart your router, 2) Position it centrally and away from interference, 3) Use an Ethernet cable for critical devices, 4) Upgrade your router if it's older than 3-4 years, 5) Contact your ISP to check if your plan meets your needs.

High ping/latency is often caused by: 1) Distance to the server you're connecting to, 2) Network congestion, 3) Wireless interference, 4) Outdated router firmware, 5) Background applications using bandwidth. Try using a wired connection and closing unused applications for better results.

For optimal router performance: 1) Place it centrally in your home, 2) Keep it elevated and away from obstructions, 3) Update the firmware regularly, 4) Consider a mesh network for larger spaces, 5) Separate 2.4GHz and 5GHz networks (5GHz is faster but has shorter range).
